Email Conversation Export
=========================

Folder: CW11SWO - cyber-insurance q&a call - marsh x chalhoub - ms teams
Message Count: 1

--------------------------------------------------
ID: CW11SWO_00
From: Dee Deu <dee.deu@chalhoub.com>
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>; Prabhat Nadipalli <Prabhat.Nadipalli@chalhoub.com>; kevork.kechichian@marsh.com <kevork.kechichian@marsh.com>; yekta.ozdinc@marsh.com <yekta.ozdinc@marsh.com>
CC: Alriyami, Mariam <Mariam.Alriyami@marsh.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2024-10-09 14:09
Subject: RE: Cyber-insurance Q&A call - Marsh x Chalhoub - MS Teams
--------------------------------------------------
Dear All, 

 

Meeting Minutes:

Date: 10/09/24
Time: 09:43:06 UTC - 09:59:03 UTC
Participants: Dee Deu, Hagop Ghazarian, Kevork Kechichian, Yekta Ozdinc, Prabhat Nadipalli

Agenda:

1.	Discussion on Cyber Insurance Policy
2.	Market Submission and Strategy
3.	Cost Estimation and Policy Limits
4.	Timeline for Quotations
5.	Internal Messaging and Next Steps

Key Discussions:

1.	Current Status:

	*	Yekta confirmed that with the current Geopolitcal issues,  there is no significant impact to the cyber insurance market in GCC however we would not be able to claim on a policy if the entire country where to targeted, we would only be able to claim on insurance if we can demonstrate that Chalhoub Group is the sole target.
	*	Dee emphasized that our Group is behind the curve but not completely immature. They have some quick wins and a strategic roadmap to address known gaps.

2.	Market Submission:

	*	Dee and Yekta discussed the need to submit the current status to the market to understand who is willing to insure them and under what exclusions.

metadata.doc_id: CW11SWO - cyber-insurance q&a call - marsh x chalhoub - ms teams\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CW11SWO - cyber-insurance q&a call - marsh x chalhoub - ms teams\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	Dee and Yekta discussed the need to submit the current status to the market to understand who is willing to insure them and under what exclusions. 
	*	Yekta advised that the market exploration may output that insurer are not willing to insure or that they are willing to insure a co-insurance policy with restrictions. This may mean that the policy is not worthwhile.
	*	Dee highlighted the importance of understanding the exclusions and whether it would be a co-insurance policy and what the business benefit is.

3.	Strategy and Funding:

	*	Dee mentioned that the strategy needs to be approved and funded to deliver year on year.  We cannot share this until it is fully approved and has been signed off. We would have to explore the market based on our current maturity status.
	*	The impact of achieving target objectives on the insurance policy was discussed, including the potential removal of restrictions and premium benefits. There would be a positive impact on the insurance policy upon the delivery of the 3 year strategic roadmap.

4.	CSA Importance:

	*	Kevork stressed the importance of the Cyber Self-Assessment (CSA) before going to market. The CSA will be reviewed by cyber experts and the advisory team to ensure minimum basic cyber hygiene is met before they can approach the market.

5.	Internal Messaging:

	*	Dee clarified with Hagop the internal messaging to ensure no over-promising and to align on the current status and next steps as discussed, which is that we are submitting to brokers to explore the market and understand who will be willing to insure based on submissions.

metadata.doc_id: CW11SWO - cyber-insurance q&a call - marsh x chalhoub - ms teams\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CW11SWO - cyber-insurance q&a call - marsh x chalhoub - ms teams\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
ng and to align on the current status and next steps as discussed, which is that we are submitting to brokers to explore the market and understand who will be willing to insure based on submissions.
	*	Dee will present the current status and next steps to the Risk and Crisis Management Committee. 

6.	Cost Estimation:

	*	Ozdinc will provide benchmarks for the cost of the policy based on the Group's revenue and current maturity status. Hagop advised the revenue is around $2 billion USD. 

7.	Timeline for Quotations:

	*	Ozdinc mentioned that initial feedback from insurers could be provided within a week after receiving the CSA. 
	*	The CSA is expected to be completed by the end of the week or the beginning of next week.

8.	Policy Limits:

	*	Hagop and Ozdinc discussed starting with a $10 million policy limit and considering a $20 million option.

Action Items:

1.	Cyber Self-Assessment (CSA): Dee's team to complete the CSA by the end of the week or beginning of next week. 
2.	Cost Benchmarks: Ozdinc to provide cost benchmarks based on the organization's revenue.
3.	Market Exploration: Ozdinc to explore the market for insurance options after receiving the CSA if it is deemed possible to achieve insurance.
4.	Internal Presentation: Dee to present the current status and next steps to the Risk and Crisis Management Committee. 

Next Steps:

*	Dee's team will finalize the CSA and submit it to Ozdinc.
*	Ozdinc will provide initial feedback from insurers as to whether they will be willing to insure, and for those that are what the co-insurance and restrictions will be as well as the cost benchmarks.

chunks.text:
Ozdinc will provide initial feedback from insurers as to whether they will be willing to insure, and for those that are what the co-insurance and restrictions will be as well as the cost benchmarks.
*	Dee will present the findings and next steps to the Risk and Crisis Management Committee.
*	The team will align on the strategy and funding to proceed with the insurance policy.

Meeting Adjourned.

 

 

DEE DEU​​​​	
DIRECTOR ‑ INFORMATION SECURITY	
M.C.T. FZE	
DUBAI	
‑	
UNITED ARAB EMIRATES
